Dear Ms. Jenovai:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on 09/30/2020.
Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and
Implementation Sustainability Exit Plan (ISEP) requirements, a written corrective action
plan is required. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also violations
of the ISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date
of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or ISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following:
R 400.12324 Reevaluation.
(2) The annual reevaluation shall include a determination and
assessment of all of the following:
(b) Family functioning and interrelationships as determined
by observation of, and interviews with, each member of the
household and each social service worker who has had children
placed in the home during the last licensing period.
One of six reevaluations reviewed did not observe and interview
each member of the household.
R 400.12326 Borrowed home.
(1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified by another
agency or tribe, the agency shall have a record containing all of
the following documents:
(e) A list of all children currently placed in the home.
Two of three borrowed home files reviewed did not have a
placement list of the children currently placed in the home.
R 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy.
(1) An agency's medical and dental care policy shall, at a
minimum, include all of the following:
(d) Current immunizations for each child as required by
section 5111 of 1978 PA 368, MCL 333.5111. All of the
following apply:
(i) A statement from a parent or licensed medical authority
which indicates that immunizations are current or
contraindicated is sufficient documentation of immunizations.
(ii) A copy of a waiver addressed to the department of
community health signed by the parent stating immunizations
are not being administered due to religious, medical, or other
reasons is sufficient documentation of immunizations.
4

(iii) If documentation of immunization or a copy of the
waiver is unavailable, then immunizations shall begin within 30
calendar days of placement.
Two of eight foster care files reviewed did not have current
immunizations.
REPEAT VIOLATION from 09/17/2019 renewal inspection
Corrective action plan approved 10/03/2019
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each child
and parent or parents, as follows:
(a) Within 30 calendar days from removal from the home.
Two of three initial service plans reviewed were not completed
within 30 calendar days from placement. One initial service plan
period was 01/30/2020 to 02/28/2020 and the report was
completed 03/05/2020. The other initial service plan period was
06/18/2020 to 07/17/2020 and the report was completed
07/20/2020.
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(6) Service plans shall be signed by the social services worker
and the social services supervisor.
Two of 16 service plans reviewed were not signed and dated by
the social service worker and social service supervisor.
2.)Any violation listed in section 1 is also an ISEP violation. Please note that there are

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas: None at this time.
5

V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas: Repeat citations require a
review and conclusion regarding the failure of the previous corrective action plan
and a plan to resolve the repeat citation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no safety issues or alerts found by the Department of Child Welfare
Licensing analyst, Charissa Williams for this inspection.
Spaulding for Children submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period. The corrective action plan is from their
09/2019 renewal inspection. Spaulding for Children is found in compliance of the
corrective action plan except for one repeat violation stated in this report.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility
continue on a regular license.
